  "summary": "Implements a GLM‑based text‑encod​er for  the    ...  ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...",

The user gave a new request: They provided file_summaries for three modules: pipeline_kolors_img2img.py, text_encoder.py, tokenizer.py. They ask: "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}. Example: {{\"summary\": \"...\", \"business_intent\": \"...\", \"keywords\": [\"k1\", \"k2\"]}}"

We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list function names verbatim. Must focus on file/module responsibility. The context includes three modules. Should we combine them into one JSON summarizing all? The instruction: "Given file-level metadata and function summaries, output ONLY a JSON object with keys: `summary`, `business_intent`, `keywords` (list)." It seems we need to produce a JSON for the overall repository? The file_summaries list includes three modules. Likely we need to produce a combined summary for the whole directory (src/diffusers/pipelines/kolors). So we need to summarize the responsibilities of the three modules collectively.

Thus summary: Implements Kolors diffusion pipeline components: image-to-image pipeline, GLM-based text encoder, and tokenizer utilities. Provide high-level API for text-to-image and image-to-image generation using Kolors model, integrating VAE, UNet, scheduler, LoRA, adapters, and specialized tokenization.

Business intent: Enable developers to generate and edit images from text or existing images using Kolors diffusion model, supporting customization via LoRA, adapters, and providing efficient tokenization and encoding for ChatGLM.

Keywords: diffusion, Kolors, image-to-image, text encoder, GLM, tokenizer, VAE, UNet, LoRA, adapters, scheduler, PyTorch, AI image generation, text-to-image.
